trans-unit.source: A standard discovery endpoint.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint"></xref> class.

By default, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryVersion%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion.WSDiscoveryApril2005> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryMode.Managed>.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint"></xref> class with the specified binding and endpoint address.

By default, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryVersion%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion.WSDiscoveryApril2005%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode%2A> is set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.ServiceDiscoveryMode.Managed>.
The binding.
The endpoint address.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint"></xref> class with the specified discovery version and mode.
An enumerated value representing one of the versions of the WS-Discovery protocols.
An enumerated value representing one of the modes used to send discovery messages.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint"></xref> class with the specified discovery version, mode, binding, and endpoint address.
An enumerated value representing one of the versions of the WS-Discovery protocols.
An enumerated value representing one of the modes used to send discovery messages.
The binding elements that specify the protocols, transports, and message encoders used for communication between clients and services.
The unique address of the discovery endpoint.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode"></xref> for the endpoint.
Discovery can be accomplished in two different modes: Ad-Hoc or Managed.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)][WCF Discovery Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-discovery-overview.md)
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.DiscoveryMode"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion"></xref> for the endpoint.
One of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryVersion"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets or sets the maximum <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> within which all of the `ProbeMatches` for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.
This value is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies a time span in which all `ProbeMatches` for a service that respond to a single probe operation are sent.
If all `ProbeMatches` are sent at the same time, a network storm may result.
To prevent this from occurring, `ProbeMatches` are sent with a random delay between each ProbeMatch.
The random delay is in the range of 0 to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A> is set to 0, then the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent in a tight loop without any delay.

Otherwise, the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent with some random delay such that the total time taken to send all `ProbeMatches` messages does not exceed the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>.
This value is only relevant for services, it is not used by clients.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> instance that contains the maximum time span within which all of the `ProbeMatches` for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.
